attributes.action: Stop the Tesco acquisition (merger or takeover) of Booker Wholesale
attributes.additional_details: The acquisition will in fact be paid for by Tesco/Booker combined Supplier base. Supply contracts will be re-negotiated, suppliers will have no choice but to reduce their margins (or lose their contracts). Margin cuts will be made by reducing head-counts, potentially reducing product ingredient quality, pack sizes and potentially the quality of food produced in the UK will suffer. New food products will find it harder to achieve a route-to-market. In the end, there will be less choice.
attributes.background: Tesco's acquisition of Booker will remove thousands of jobs from the UK food supply chain. No company will be unaffected; Tesco and Booker themselves; suppliers of food, logistics, and suppliers to these suppliers; packaging, food ingredient, transport. Supplier margins will erode, jobs will go.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). It's been announced that the CMA will be looking into this.

You can find out more here: 
https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/competition-and-markets-authority
